Class BinaryNode

java.lang.Object
  BinaryNode

public class BinaryNode
extends java.lang.Object

Define a binary node of a binary tree. A node has a reference to a left and right child (null if a child doesn't exist). A node also has data (of type char) and a point specifying where the center of the node exists in an in-order graphical representation.

Version:
1.0 2005-OCT-21
Author:
Rob Bauer

Constructor Detail

BinaryNode

public BinaryNode(char nodeData)
Setup a node using the supplied character as the node's data. Assign the children to null.

Parameters:
nodeData - a character to be stored in the node
Method Detail

insert

public void insert(char insertValue)
Insert data into node. If the left child is null, insert a new node with the supplied data there. Otherwise setup a new node as the right child.

Parameters:
insertValue - data to insert

insertLeft

public void insertLeft(char insertValue)
Insert data into the node, for the left child only. Check if the left child is null or not. If it is, then add a new node using the supplied insert value. If its not null, then

insertValue - data to insert

isLeaf

public boolean isLeaf()
Check if the current node is a leaf or not. It is a leaf if both left and right children are null.

Returns:
true if there's a leaf, otherwise false

setCenterPoint

public void setCenterPoint(int x,
                           int y)
Set the point location for a node in the binary tree graphic.

Parameters:
x - integer x value
y - integer y value

getCenterPoint

public java.awt.Point getCenterPoint()
Get the node's graphical location used in the binary tree graphic.

Returns:
Point containing the center x and y location of the node in the binary tree graphic
